cyclone.name: ARTHUR
cyclone.current_location: about 190 miles ENE of Cape Canaveral, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northeast, forecast to parallel the Southeast coast and pass near or just east of the North Carolina Outer Banks Monday before accelerating northeastward away from the Mid-Atlantic coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just east of the North Carolina Outer Banks (no direct landfall currently forecast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Surf City to Duck NC including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.warning_coast: None (a warning may be issued later for the same North Carolina coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: East coast from central Florida northward through the Carolinas and portions of the Mid-Atlantic including New Jersey
weather_observation.wind: Brief periods of 20–30 mph gusts possible; tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely (≤3 % chance).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Delaware River port facilities.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could bring 0.5–1.0 inch of rain Monday evening into Tuesday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along the New Jersey shore Monday-Tuesday could disrupt pilot boat operations and berthing.
